description: Used before nouns to refer to non-specific or one of many items.
To cease to support or look after; to desert.
The quality of being able to do something; a skill or talent.
Having the skill, power, or means to do something.
On the subject of; concerning.
At a higher level or position than something else.
In or to a foreign country.
Not qualified or diminished in any way; total.
Completely and without qualification; totally.
Related to education, especially at a college or university; a person engaged in scholarly pursuits.
To receive or agree to take something offered.
Able to be agreed on; satisfactory.
The means or opportunity to approach or enter a place; to obtain or retrieve information.
An unfortunate incident that happens unexpectedly and unintentionally.
A place where people live or stay, typically temporarily.
The eighth month of the year, in the northern hemisphere usually considered the last month of summer.
The sister of one's father or mother or the wife of one's uncle.
A writer of a book, article, or report.
The power or right to give orders, make decisions, and enforce obedience.
The season between summer and winter, comprising in the northern hemisphere usually the months of September, October, and November.
Present and ready for use; at one's disposal.
The result obtained by adding several amounts together and then dividing this total by the number of amounts; typical or normal.
To keep away from or stop oneself from doing something.
A prize or other mark of recognition given in honor of an achievement; to give or order the giving of (something) as an official payment, compensation, or prize to.
Having knowledge or perception of a situation or fact.
At a distance from a particular place, person, or thing.
Very bad or unpleasant.
